rules.natural: Provided that a researcher publishes a paper, society controls a disease.
Under the condition that a team identifies a virus, society controls a disease.
Whenever a team identifies a host, society controls a disease.
If a team monitors an outbreak, then either that team identifies a virus or that team identifies a host.
An outbreak contains a region or a team monitors an outbreak.
An agency imposes a quarantine or an agency imposes a travel ban.
Provided that an agency imposes a travel ban, an outbreak does not contain a region.
If an agency approves a vaccine, then a vaccine deploys to a population.
If an agency approves a vaccine, then a vaccine does not deploy to a population.
An agency approves a vaccine or, if an agency recommends a measure, then the condition that an agency imposes a quarantine implies that an outbreak does not contain a region.
Provided that a virus infects a human, society controls a disease.
If a lab sequences a genome, then data uploads to a database.
Provided that data analyzes a genome, a virus does not mutate into a strain.
If data uploads to a database, then data analyzes a genome.
If an agency funds research, then the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.
An agency funds research or an agency collaborates with a university.
If a university shares findings, then the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.
Provided that a researcher studies a virus, a researcher publishes a paper.
If a committee delays an approval, then a trial halts a vaccine.
A committee delays an approval or, if an agency collaborates with a university, then a university shares findings.

Provided that the WHO declares an emergency, the following holds: if it is not the case that imposing a quarantine implies an outbreak does not contain a region, then an outbreak escalates into a pandemic.
Under the condition that the WHO alerts a country, the WHO declares an emergency.
The WHO alerts a country or the WHO alerts a region.
If the WHO alerts a region, then the WHO declares an emergency.

rules.prover9_expression: (publishes(journal, study) -> (-(-(-(sequences(lab, genome) -> analyzes(data, genome)) -> -discovers(researcher, variant)) -> confirms(test, variant)) -> warns(health_org, public)))
rules.natural: Provided that a journal publishes a study, the following holds: if it is not the case that (it is not the case that (it is not the case that sequencing a genome implies analyzing a genome) implies a researcher does not discover a variant) implies a test confirms a variant, then a health organization warns the public.
Under the condition that a researcher studies a bat, a virus infects a human.
Provided that a lab tests a drug, a drug cures a virus.

rules.prover9_expression: (uses(lab, model) -> (-(-(studies(researcher, virus) | studies(researcher, bat)) -> develops(researcher, drug)) -> tests(lab, drug)))
rules.natural: If a lab uses a model, then the following holds: if it is not the case that (it is not the case that a researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat) implies a researcher develops a drug, then a lab tests a drug.

rules.prover9_expression: (uses(lab, simulation) -> (-(-(studies(researcher, virus) | studies(researcher, bat)) -> develops(researcher, drug)) -> tests(lab, drug)))
rules.natural: Provided that a lab uses a simulation, the following holds: if it is not the case that (it is not the case that a researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat) implies a researcher develops a drug, then a lab tests a drug.
If it is not the case that sequencing a genome implies analyzing a genome, then a researcher discovers a variant.
Under the condition that it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, a company profits from a vaccine.
Under the condition that it is not the case that a lab uses a model or a lab uses a simulation, a model validates a drug.
Provided that it is not the case that a lab uses a model or a lab uses a simulation, a model does not validate a drug.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(studies(researcher, virus) | studies(researcher, bat)) -> develops(researcher, drug)) -> -cures(drug, virus))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that (it is not the case that a researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat) implies a researcher develops a drug, then a drug does not cure a virus.
Under the condition that society does not control a disease, a virus mutates into a strain.
Provided that society does not control a disease, a lab sequences a genome.
Provided that society does not control a disease, a company licenses a technology.

A trial does not halt a vaccine.
An outbreak does not escalate into a pandemic.
A test does not confirm a variant.
A health organization does not warn the public.
A researcher does not develop a drug.

Provided that it is not the case that (it is not the case that (it is not the case that sequencing a genome implies analyzing a genome) implies a researcher does not discover a variant) implies a test confirms a variant, a health organization warns the public.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that a researcher publishes a paper, society controls a disease.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either a researcher publishes a paper or a virus infects a human.

(A11 → G).natural: Under the condition that a team identifies a virus, society controls a disease.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: A team identifies a virus or a team identifies a host.

(A12 → G).natural: Whenever a team identifies a host, society controls a disease.

(A13 → (A11 ∨ A12)).natural: If a team monitors an outbreak, then either that team identifies a virus or that team identifies a host.

(A14 ∨ A13).natural: An outbreak contains a region or a team monitors an outbreak.

(A15 → ¬A14).natural: If an agency imposes a quarantine, then it is not the case that an outbreak contains a region.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: An agency imposes a quarantine or an agency imposes a travel ban.

(A16 → ¬A14).natural: Provided that an agency imposes a travel ban, an outbreak does not contain a region.

(A17 → (A15 → ¬A14)).natural: Under the condition that an agency recommends a measure, the following holds: if an agency imposes a quarantine, then an outbreak does not contain a region.

(A18 → A19).natural: If an agency approves a vaccine, then a vaccine deploys to a population.

(A18 → ¬A19).natural: If an agency approves a vaccine, then a vaccine does not deploy to a population.

(A18 ∨ (A17 → (A15 → ¬A14))).natural: An agency approves a vaccine or, if an agency recommends a measure, then the condition that an agency imposes a quarantine implies that an outbreak does not contain a region.

(A2 → G).natural: Provided that a virus infects a human, society controls a disease.

(A21 → A22).natural: Whenever a lab sequences a genome, data analyzes a genome.

(A21 → A23).natural: If a lab sequences a genome, then data uploads to a database.

(A21 → ¬A20).natural: Under the condition that a lab sequences a genome, it is not the case that a virus mutates into a strain.

(A22 → ¬A20).natural: Provided that data analyzes a genome, a virus does not mutate into a strain.

(A23 → A22).natural: If data uploads to a database, then data analyzes a genome.

(A25 → A24).natural: Provided that a company licenses a technology, a company patents a vaccine.

(A27 → (¬(A25 → A24) → ¬A26)).natural: If an agency funds research, then the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.

(A27 ∨ A28).natural: An agency funds research or an agency collaborates with a university.

(A28 → (¬(A25 → A24) → ¬A26)).natural: Provided that an agency collaborates with a university, the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.

(A28 → A29).natural: Under the condition that an agency collaborates with a university, a university shares findings.

(A29 → (¬(A25 → A24) → ¬A26)).natural: If a university shares findings, then the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.

(A3 → A1).natural: Provided that a researcher studies a virus, a researcher publishes a paper.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: A researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat.

(A30 → A31).natural: If a committee delays an approval, then a trial halts a vaccine.

(A30 ∨ (A28 → A29)).natural: A committee delays an approval or, if an agency collaborates with a university, then a university shares findings.

(A33 → (¬(A15 → ¬A14) → A32)).natural: Provided that the WHO declares an emergency, the following holds: if it is not the case that imposing a quarantine implies an outbreak does not contain a region, then an outbreak escalates into a pandemic.

(A34 → A33).natural: Under the condition that the WHO alerts a country, the WHO declares an emergency.

(A34 ∨ A35).natural: The WHO alerts a country or the WHO alerts a region.

(A35 → A33).natural: If the WHO alerts a region, then the WHO declares an emergency.
